fields.description:
It would be great to have a way to access the unified diff for a file between two revisions. Right now to generate a diff, I have to download the raw file for both revisions and perform it manually. It would save bandwidth for all parties to have this directly accessible.

Perhaps something like https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/<user</<repo>/diff/<rev1>/<rev2>/mydir/myfile would work.
fields.summary: Provide unified diffs via the REST API (BB-2923)

fields.description: I've setup a Flowdock service for a bitbucket repo, but when the notification arrives in the Flowdock inbox the link on the repo name is broken. It's just a relative link, eg: href="/USERNAME/REPONAME" - it needs to be an absolute url to "http://bitbucket.org/USERNAME/REPONAME".
fields.summary: Flowdock notification, repo name link is broken

fields.description:
Greetings, i'm having a problem i have 2 bitbucket account( just discoreved this one infact xD)

whenever i want to reset the password of this account (https://bitbucket.org/Dekona) the new password doesn't update.

I would like to have a new password for the account Dekona, thanks you very much.

fields.description:

My repository is https://crazyDiamond@bitbucket.org/crazyDiamond/yoyoma.git

I am asked to enter a password (openssh_ and I enter my bitbucket password. Not sure if this is right.

Then it comes up with Authentication failed. I did not want to use ssh. Not sure what I am doing wrong here?

fields.description: When editing an issue, I attempted to change the status of the issue from new to resolved and it dropped down the list of choices but wouldn't let me select the choice.  I found a work around by right clicking the text in the drop down list and then using the arrow keys to change the selection.  I'm running IE 9.0.3 on Windows 7.
fields.summary: Issue status drop down list doesn't allow selection with mouse in IE9 (BB-2921)

Hi,

When trying to view a git branch linked from the repo nav [https://bitbucket.org/contentbloom/epse/src/7cde7ec1d9ac] I get a 404 error.

I guess this is wrong?

fields.description: The page at /repo/mine lists the number of followers for each one of my repos. The number for most repos is completely wrong. For half the repos it says "3" but clicking it shows just 1 follower - myself.
fields.summary: Wrong number of followers

When I hit the embed link (for example https://bitbucket.org/tebeka/go-wise/src/096c425dcb6d/expvar-demo.go), instead of the script tag I get the actual script code.

Added the script code (<script src=....embed=t>...) still works.

fields.description:
Currently, if I click the "Code"-button in the wiki wysiwyg-editor, "Python" is the default language.

It would be a nice improvement if you'd use my repo's language, if set, instead. I have selected PHP as the language for my project, and for all of the code I'm pasting into wiki-pages I have to change it to "php" manually.
fields.summary: Use repository language as default when adding code in the wiki (BB-2943)
Can't upload public ssh-key (BB-3096)

fields.summary: Allow issue attachments via the REST API (BB-2913)
Building a query for issues where "Responsible" is "Unassigned" doesn't work

fields.description: asdasd
fields.summary: not able to delete the alias name after adding

fields.description:
On my static site server, kevinburke.bitbucket.org/markdowncss and kevinburke.bitbucket.org/markdowncss/

go to two separate places. This violates my expectation (and is hurting my Google search traffic for "markdown css"). I also tried adding a static file called markdowncss that would add a 301 redirect to the directory with the trailing slash, but it looks like you can't have a file and a directory with the same name together (at least easily).

In nginx, it looks like you have to add this setting:

{{{\\
rewrite ^(.*[^/])$ $1/ permanent;\\
}}}

to append the trailing slash to URL's that don't already have it. For more see this Stackoverflow question at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/645853/add-slash-to-the-end-of-every-url-need-rewrite-rule-for-nginx.
fields.summary: Static file directories should append trailing slash to URL (BB-2909)

fields.description:
I using Windows 7 and Git under CygWin.

but when I commit and input a commit message, there's a line said "encoding GBK", but I checked the file encoding by vim, it really is UTF-8, and there's only english characters.

I had tried using CLI under cygwin or TortoiseGit, but both failed.
fields.summary: Commit Message Error
dbname in table creation

fields.description:
Found that the comment in\\
myid int serial COMMENT 'this is my id for the table foo'\\
takes the comment as the name for the column.
fields.summary: COMMENT as token

fields.description:
As in topic:

After i autorized a site to my repositories wia oauth - id want to be able to revoke the access if needed on bitbucket itself, i cant seem to find page that would allow to do that.
fields.summary: After i authorize some 3rd party service to access my private and public repositories - i cant revoke it from bitbucket level

fields.description:
When communicating with other users using the Messaging system, formatting doesn't work. Granted, there is no WYSIWYG included in the messaging system, but I wouldn't have guessed that meant there is no support for Wiki-style URLs, for instance (i.e. - [[http://example.com|example]], which allows a URL using the double-bracket syntax).

Also there is no ability to edit a message, which would normally be fine, until I make the mistake of using the Wiki-formatting in a submitted message.

There's no ability to preview either. Fun!
fields.summary: No formatting allowed in messaging system (BB-2912)

fields.description:
== Better download user interface ==

I would love that Bitbucket could provide a similar interface to Sourceforge:

h1. Management of folder system to organise downloads
h1. Apply an automatic readme section below the list of downloads in that folder for quick explanations of what is provided to download.
Thanks so far for a really easy and sweet project space to do open source development!

Best regards\\
Gunther Strube, @cambridge & @gbs
fields.summary: Support folders and readme's in folders for downloads (BB-2911)

fields.description:
I can't open directories or files that contain russian letters in the path. E.g.:

https://bitbucket.org/iofik/shad/src/04e49488e122/Семестр4/Лингвистика/task2/words_corpus.py

or

https://bitbucket.org/iofik/shad/src/7fac2a58af9e/%D0%A1%D0%B5%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82%D1%804/%D0%9B%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B3%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B0/task2/words_corpus.py
fields.summary: Can't traverse directories with cyrillic letters in the name (BB-2908)

fields.description:
Hi, in the Username Aliases management page that is currently up, it is not very clear what is meant by "Username" and what is meant by "Alias" - both of them are marked as compulsory.

For example, in the screenshot (attached with this issue) of this BitBucket help page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Setting+up+User+Aliasing+for+your+Repositories, it is quite self-explanatory what is meant by the two fields of the page - one is *BitBucket* username and another is *External* username.

However, it is not *that*//// self explanatory in the actual Username Aliases management page that is currently up in BitBucket repo admin page.

regards\\
Rakib
fields.summary: On Alias Management page change username to bitbucket username (BB-2915)

fields.description:
When I get a notification of an issue update and I reply via email my commnents never seem to get in to the issue.

I have sent numerous emails to https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/pytest/issue/50/select-tests-according-to-their-mark and then have to go to the site to update it.
fields.summary: Emails never seem to get through to issues

fields.description: The title says it all really :)

My commits that have been merged into from a pull request show my local username with the local machine name I was working on. See https://bitbucket.org/jmurty/jets3t/changesets

I don't see a way to change this into showing my real name.

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket we have a "bad" pull request that we can't reject, any chance you could clear it? thanks

https://bitbucket.org/ombu/mentor-va/pull-requests

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to visually group related repos (that may or may not be subrepos) into project groups. These groups should have a definable URI. This would be particularly useful when using a custom domain and wanting to be able to link to a specific set of related repos. I know that I could do this using static files on my BB homepage but that's a little bit clunky. Have I missed another way to do this?

Cheers

Greg
fields.summary: Visually group repositories into projects

fields.description: Since bookmarks typically move around, I would expect to find them in the branches list instead of the tags list.
fields.summary: Mercurial bookmarks should show up in the branches list (BB-2910)

fields.description:
Windows 7 64bit\\
Build: Sat Oct  1 09:52:06 2011 Release

効果音再生イベント画面でwavファイルを再生すると、\\
以下のような状態になってしまいました

音声設定\\
SDLの場合　音が鳴らない　\\
MCIの場合　エラー表示もなくcwxeditorが強制終了　エラーログに残っていない

その後Cardwirth、CardwirthEditor、CardwirthPyエンジンで\\
鳴るかどうか試してみたのですが、効果音は鳴りました

大方こちらの環境のサウンドドライバのせいであると思いますが\\
報告させていただきます

fields.description:
Hello,

Would be possible to implement a counter in the bitbucket web interface in order to obtain information about the number of times that a repository is cloned, downloaded via 'get source' button or via 'downloads' tab?

It would be nice too a tab in the web imterface providing some code metrics as number of files, total lines of code, blank lines, comments lines, etc. For example the perl script cloc (http://http://cloc.sourceforge.net/) could be used (it provides more detailed information than sloccount, for example)

Thanks
fields.summary: Download and clone counter and source code metrics (BB-502)

fields.description:
Hello,

When auto-closing an issue via a commit, the changeset link is wrong. This happens when a custom domain is used to access BitBucket.

Example:\\
http://code.alanhaggai.org/alanhaggai/repo_name/changeset/21a4ed9157c3

It should be:\\
http://code.alanhaggai.org/repo_name/changeset/21a4ed9157c3

Please look into it.

Regards,\\
Alan Haggai Alavi.
fields.summary: Link to changeset is wrong when auto-closing issues via commits (BB-3147)

submodules ( git ) and subrepositories ( hg ) show the link to the repository, but should also show the specific revision that is being pointed to, and where possible, the link should link to the same specific revision.

( I hate to say "like github does", but... yeah, it's a good example )

fields.description:
Using pss for the first time to look at files in a dir.  Both files have the word  "module" on every line. Bah!

{{{\\
Traceback (most recent call last):\\
File "c:/msys/1.0/usr/bin/pss", line 2, in <module>\\
from psslib.pss import main; main()\\
File "c:\Python27\lib\site-packages\psslib\pss.py", line 95, in main\\
ncontext_after=ncontext_after)\\
File "c:\Python27\lib\site-packages\psslib\driver.py", line 168, in pss_run\\
max_match_count=max_match_count)\\
File "c:\Python27\lib\site-packages\psslib\contentmatcher.py", line 54, in *init*\\
literal_pattern=literal_pattern)\\
File "c:\Python27\lib\site-packages\psslib\contentmatcher.py", line 99, in _create_regex\\
regex = re.compile(pattern, re.I if ignore_case else 0)\\
File "c:\Python27\lib\re.py", line 190, in compile\\
return _compile(pattern, flags)\\
File "c:\Python27\lib\re.py", line 245, in _compile\\
raise error, v # invalid expression\\
sre_constants.error: nothing to repeat\\
}}}

fields.description: For non-Python repositories, naming the file "README" or "README.txt" does the job, but for Python repos these are treated as reStructuredText. This forces users to remove the language selection or use a nonstandard file name in order to have a README treated as plaintext.
fields.summary: Accommodate plaintext READMEs in Python repos (BB-2892)

fields.description:

Thx.

Please add vertical scroll on every page (BB-2893)

Just a proposal (:

fields.description:
Please provide the ability to view all issues "assigned to me" across all projects. Please also provide a similar ability, so that I can view all issues that have been assigned to one of my team members, across all projects.

The latter part of this request may be best suited for some type of "Organization" grouping for teams/projects, such as seen at Github.
fields.summary: View issues across all projects

fields.description:
I image you've thought of it, but consider this one more official request! Please let us fork repositories from Github and send pull requests there (assuming it's possible in the API).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Fork from Github (BB-2886)

fields.description:
I find it really annoying that by default the issues are sorted by //date created// rather than //most important// (blocker, critical, major, etc...).

It's a super simple fix and it would be a lovely one to make!
fields.summary: Remember the last Issue sort per user (BB-4087)

fields.description:
I registered for bitbucket with openid so consequently I don't have a bitbucket password.

There seems to be no way of making a bitbucket password (since the forms all ask for the old password which I don't have, obviously).

The trouble is, a password seems to be required for important operations like removing a repository.
fields.summary: openid users don't have proper accounts and can't change passwords?

fields.description:
Two former team members are still receiving  e-mails regarding issue tracking. It happens whenever I change an issue that was originally created by them.

They've told me to stop these e-mails from being sent. Also, I do not like them to receive updates on these issues.

Can I (or they) disable this? Preferably in a central location so that I don't have to change all the individual issues.
fields.summary: Former team members still receiving e-mails re issue tracking (BB-3159)

fields.description:
Hi,

I created a new repository by importing http://projects.vdr-developer.org/git/vdr.git/

The repository imported fine and I have been able to clone out from the repository to my local machine.

The repository is listed in my Repositories list in my browser, however why I try and navigate to it, I get the "Someone kicked over the bucket" error page.

Many thanks,

Richard
fields.summary: Oops page after importing GIT repository (BB-2865)

fields.description:
View:\\
https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine

The stats for commits and followers (probably forks as well but since I don't have public repos so I don't know) are wrong.

For commits stat, it doesn't count the commits for an imported Git repo. Say if you import a Git repo with lots of commits already from somewhere else, it will still show 0 commit. But the followers stat will be 1 more (e.g., even if you are the only user for this repo, you will see 2 in the follower stat if imported).

For followers stat, if you cancel follow and then follow again (to your own private repo), the followers stat increases.

I believe the stats are stored separately. It is understandable for performance reason, but I think the workflow should be corrected to reflect the right stats and also you may want to do a system-wide re-calculation to fix the existing wrong stats.
fields.summary: repos summary stats error

fields.description:
When a repository has a committer whose username has not been assigned an alias yet, the committer display name provides a link to the Username Aliases administration page. This link includes the committer's username as a GET param, but the username is not actually prefilled into the form.

This is quite annoying, as an unknown username will have "..." included on the commit display screen, so the only way to find the full username value is to manually find it's existence in the URL to Username Aliases Administration, to then copy/paste into the form.

Based on the URL intention, it seems this either used to function as expected, or was simply never completed.

Example URL:\\
https://bitbucket.org/USER/REPO/admin/committers?username=someuser@somedomain.local&back=/USER/REPO/changeset/25313c467fd5

*CORRECTION:* It's actually the "Alias" field that I'm expecting to pre-fill, and it's the alias that is passed in the "username" GET parameter.
fields.summary: Username not pre-filled when adding missing committer alias (BB-2836)

fields.description:
Hey people,

I noticed some lack of URL validation on the import script at: https://bitbucket.org/repo/import

If I set the URL to for example https://github.com/ikanobori/deposit it will throw a 500 error when I submit the form.

A helpful error message or the URL you actually want (the one pointing to the git repo itself) would be nice :-) (or deduce it from the input github URL).
fields.summary: 500 when trying to import data from github

fields.description: For two of my repos I've set their status to public but the icon, when I look my repos say its still private. Is this a bug or just an update delay?
fields.summary: Private/Public Status

fields.description:
In the case of an RSS feed: https://bitbucket.org/rayburgemeestre/rss/feed?token=<some_token>

The "began following" events are malformed. Generated XML is:

{code}
    <title>
        rayburgemeestre began following SanderVellinga
    </link>
{code}

The "</link>" should have been a "</title>".

Ray Burgemeestre

Initialized empty Git repository in /home/bfawcett/Desktop/Atlassian/test-code/clock/.git/\\
Password:\\

I think maybe just checking duplicates is enough for those secondary emails. Thanks.
fields.summary: Adding more emails to accounts should not need to confirm in advance

Hi,

Previously I had access to another user' s private repository so I was following that, eventually I got my access removed from that repository.

Thanks in advance for this excellent service!

Thanks,

* Vann

But if you are part of the very same projects, you should ideally be shown a list of the private projects that user is a member of, that you have permission to see as well.

Here's what I run and what I get:

{{{\\

pushing to https://bitbucket.org/andrew_rocktech/rocktech\\
searching for changes\\
1 changesets found\\
abort: HTTP Error 502: Bad Gateway\\

Any help?
fields.summary: Hg push results in 502.

fields.description: If you link a change set to an issue (with git) using re #issue then the CS will point to the issue but the issue will now show any reference to the change-set.
fields.summary: Linking a Changeset to a Issue does not show in issue (BB-2851)

fields.description:
When In Admin/Access Management and other sub menu choces there is no token on the RSS link that is displayed. for the project.

I cant really figure out when the token is missing but sometimes it is not vissible
fields.summary: No Token to RSS feed when in Admin (IE) (BB-2846)

fields.description:
After deleting a remote branch the web interface just shows an error on load. Interacting with bitbucket through git command line is still fine.\\
All other repository pages still respond.

Affected repository: https://bitbucket.org/rmwcs/veli

Command issued: git push origin :247_general_web_testing_doc

Martin
fields.summary: Delete remote git branch causes issue for web interface
Allow users to add a title to SSH keys (BB-2841)

fields.description: I would love it if you released a iPhone/iPad application for BitBucket!!!
fields.summary: iPhone/iPad Applications (BB-3143)

fields.description:
My name is Alexey Petriashev,\\
my id name is alexey.petriashev.\\
I pushed commit with name alexey.petriashev but can not see it on my page.

Name alias works only in repository
fields.summary: Can't see my commit activity

fields.description:
Now that we have the ability to create Git repositories, and fork repos from Github to Bitbucket, what we are missing is one final thing: the ability to fork from a Git repo (on Github or Bitbucket) to a //Mercurial// repo.

This would require the internal use of something like Hg/Git. But it would allow those of us who would rather not learn how to use Git to be able to work more easily with projects that do use Git.
fields.summary: Github to Mercurial repo

fields.description: It would be nice to have the ability to do the webhook reporting to campfire. It is a thing I miss from github.
fields.summary: Add a Campfire service (BB-2842)

fields.description:
"close/closed/closes/closing/fix/fixed/fixes    # resolves the issue"

Can you add "resolves" to that list of keywords? Why do "fixes" and "closes" resolve the issue but "resolves" does not? o.O
fields.summary: Add "resolves" as keyword to Issues Service (BB-2847)

fields.description: I hate when I forget to click the "follow" link for every issue I'm participating in -- please add a setting to enable auto-following of all issues I've edited/commented on.
fields.summary: Ability to auto-follow issues I'm participating (BB-2843)

fields.description: Switching branch on file or folder existing in both branches should not bring you to the repository's root and should just refresh the current view.
fields.summary: Branch/tag menu links should respect source browser path (BB-2845)

fields.description:
After trying to import a repository and getting stuck in a look importing and deleted repositories staying in the "My Repository" list I deleted my account.

I then created a new account with the same username/email address, received a new confirmation email and logged in.

The new account was already populated with the data from the deleted account, including the deleted repositories still visible on the "My Repositories" screen.

I logged in with a different browser never used with bitbucket.org to confirm that the browser hadn't cached any data and saw the same results.
fields.summary: Delete account and recreate shows previous details (BB-2849)

fields.description:
Hi,

Today I got a mail saying that I (alien8) was mentioned in some\\
commit. However, it wasn't me. The mail is attached.\\
What your site found was a match of my user name to the domain name of the mentioned guy.

Please, I do not want to get an e-mail each time someone with the domain alien8.de is quoted on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Wrong notification of mention (BB-2818)

fields.description:
The branch list is not sorted naturally making it hard to locate logically named branches (see attached file).

It would be useful if it could be sorted naturally.
fields.summary: Sorted branch list (BB-2835)

fields.description:
The newsfeed has avatar images and links for each user. It looks like if a user has a full real name entered, the link generated is based off of that, and the link therefore 404s.

Example:\\
The avatar image for me is in a <a href="/Marshall%20Pierce">. This 404s. /marshallpierce, however, works fine. For users that don't have a full name entered, the link uses their username (not their full name) and it works fine.
fields.summary: The newsfeed is generating public links off of full name instead of username (BB-2837)
